definition: to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
in a catatonic state/shocked and stunned (idiom)

sentences.english: They gazed in awe at their hero.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子默默无言，以畏怯的目光凝视着他。

sentences.english: I gaze on the moon as I tread the drear wild.
sentences.chinese: 行在阴霾的旷野我凝视着天上的月。

sentences.english: She peered at the neighbors from behind the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 她从帘子后面凝视着邻居们。

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们在教室相互凝视着，各自嘲笑对方所讲的笑话。

sentences.english: Romeo gazed up to Juliet on her balcony.
sentences.chinese: 罗蜜欧在阳台上凝视著茱丽叶。

sentences.english: Jike quietly contemplates a picturesque scene on a magazine page hung on the wall;
sentences.chinese: 尼西静静地凝视着墙上挂着的杂志封面上独特的风景。

sentences.english: The earth belongs to anyone who stops for a moment, gazes and goes on his way.
sentences.chinese: 地球属于那些停留片刻，凝视它，然后继续赶路的人。
柯瑟琳凝视着这两张面孔。

sentences.english: His face peers anxiously into mine.
sentences.chinese: 他一脸忧虑地凝视着我的脸。

sentences.english: The little boy gazed longingly at the toy truck he wasn't allowed to buy.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩很渴望地凝视著那个他不准买的玩具卡车。

sentences.english: One evening she was staring vacantly at an embroidered hanging.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，她茫然地凝视着一张挂毯。

sentences.english: I stand in the street opposite Shasha, I can not stop staring.
sentences.chinese: 我傻傻的站在街对面，不能停止我的凝视。

sentences.english: I took a deep breath, gazed up at the sky and turned to Izumi.
sentences.chinese: 我深深地吸了一口气，凝视了一下天空，然后转向泉。

sentences.english: Jake stares at the strange and wild alien tableau.
sentences.chinese: 杰克凝视着这个外星球的奇怪而充满野性的动人场面。

sentences.english: The boy gazed at his uncle from those big, hot, blue eyes, set rather close together.
sentences.chinese: 男孩一双热切的，紧蹙的蓝色大眼睛凝视着叔叔。

sentences.english: "Nothing, sir, " Yang answered as he pored over the data flashing on his screens.
sentences.chinese: “没有异常，长官，”杨凝视着闪烁的显示屏说道。

definition: to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to remain silent/to have nothing to say
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
